DAZ Studio Plug-in Samples

Several sample plug-ins are included in the DAZ Studio SDK to illustrate some of the most common methods of extending DAZ Studio and to help get you started developing your own plug-ins. You are free to modify, compile, and use the plug-ins for yourself. You may not redistribute any portion or derivation of the samples, whether in source code or compiled binary versions except as allowed in the DAZ Studio SDK EULA. Please see the DAZ Studio SDK End User License Agreement (EULA) for full details.

The following is a list and brief descriptions of the sample plug-ins shipped with the DAZ Studio SDK:

A First Plug-in Action/Dialog An example of a DzAction subclass that extends the interface of DAZ Studio by displaying a QDialog subclass that presents a "Hello, World!" message to the user.
Black Hole Modifier An example of a DzWSModifier subclass that adds a new World Space Modifier to DAZ Studio.
Full Screen Action An example of a DzAction subclass that extends the interface of DAZ Studio by expanding the active viewport to full sceen mode.
Scene Info Pane An example of a DzPane subclass that extends the interface of DAZ Studio with a scene information tab.
Custom Elements An example on how to extend certain DAZ Studio elements such as a DzNode or a DzModifier and save data custom to the implementation.
Custom Scene Data An example on how to add a scene data item with custom data. If not doing a custom element, plugin developers can use this to save data with the scene.
